PSS Sleman Kehilangan Brian Ferreira Sampai Akhir Musim
06 Nov 2019, 02:54 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - PSS Sleman harus kehilangan pemain andalan, Brian Ferreira. Pemain asal Argentina ini harus rehat panjang demi pemulihan cedera yang dialami saat melawan Persija Jakarta.
Mantan pemain Johor Darul Ta'zim tersebut divonis tim medis mengalami luka di bagian ulu hati. “Berdasarkan hasil pemeriksaan medis, Brian tidak bisa membela tim lagi sampai akhir kompetisi. Kami sudah berbicara tadi,” ujar pelatih PSS Sleman, Seto Nurdiyantoro, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Ia menyatakan dari hasil pemeriksaan magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), ulu hati Brian sobek tiga sentimeter. Adapun dokter tim PSS Sleman, Hernawan Sukoco, menyatakan bahwa Brian memang harus menjalani terapi panjang yang membuatnya harus absen hingga akhir musim.
Hernawan menjelaskan tidak mudah bagi dokter untuk menyembuhkan luka di ulu hati Brian dengan cepat. Menurut dia, diperlukan masa pemulihan yang panjang dan pengobatan yang tepat agar kondisi pemain tidak semakin memburuk.
Jalan satu-satunya yang medis anut saat ini, lanjut dia, ialah dengan istirahat dan fisioterapi. Proses itu membutuh waktu minimal 6-8 minggu. Otomatis dengan rentang waktu tersebut Brian akan sulit untuk kembali bergabung sebelum kompetisi 2019 berakhir.
"Ada kemungkinan kami kirim Brian kembali ke Argentina untuk proses penyembuhan di sana agar dekat dengan keluarga. Kami harapkan selain penyembuhan fisik juga akan membuat kondisi mentalnya juga kembali membaik," ujar Hernawan.

PSS Sleman Lost Brian Ferreira Until the End of the Season
06 Nov 2019, 02:54 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - Sleman PSS has to lose its flagship player, Brian Ferreira. The Argentine player must take a long break for the recovery of injuries suffered against Jakarta against Persija.
The former Johor Darul Ta'zim player was convicted by the medical team to be injured in the solar plexus. "Based on the results of the medical examination, Brian could not defend the team again until the end of the competition. We spoke earlier, "said Sleman PSS trainer, Seto Nurdiyantoro, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
He stated from the results of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) tests, Brian's solar plexus was torn by three centimeters. The Sleman PSS team doctor, Hernawan Sukoco, stated that Brian did have to undergo lengthy therapy which made him absent until the end of the season.
Hernawan explained it was not easy for doctors to heal wounds in Brian's solar plexus quickly. According to him, a long recovery period and appropriate treatment are needed so that the player's condition does not worsen.
The only way that is medical today, he continued, is with rest and physiotherapy. The process takes a minimum of 6-8 weeks. Automatically with that time span Brian will find it hard to rejoin before the 2019 competition ends.
"It's possible we sent Brian back to Argentina for the healing process there to be close to his family. We hope that in addition to physical healing it will also improve his mental condition," Hernawan said.
